team.name: Chalak
team.bio: Chalak created and coded the About Us page for the Norwich Sustainability Group website and worked on the JSON translation so our content can be easily shown in different languages such as Welsh, Spanish and English. Making the website more accessible.

team.name: Adam
team.bio: Adam designed and built the Home page, focusing on a nice clean layout that makes it easy to find information about our Sustainability goals. He enjoys experimenting with colors, shapes to make the layout as user friendly as possible.

team.name: Martha
team.bio: Martha developed the Sign Up page, making sure the form is simple, clear and accessible for new members. She is interested in making online experiences smooth and helping more people get involved in sustainability projects.

team.name: Tyler
team.bio: Tyler worked on the Goals page, presenting our sustainability aims like Clean Water, Climate Action and Quality Education in a clear way. He enjoys organising information so visitors can quickly understand what we stand for and how they can help.

education.title: Challenges within Education
education.info:
Education is one of the most important factors affecting 
            peoples' opportunities in life, and many children are still not in 
            education. There remains a gender divide within education, as many 
            women and girls cannot access education at all, or may have more 
            limited options in terms of the subjects they are allowed to study. 
            Additionally, there is a large digital divide within different parts 
            of the world, which can prevent the same quality of education being 
            available to everyone. Digital divide refers to the fact that not 
            everyone has the same access to technology and the internet. This can 
            prevent students from being able to learn as effectively, and deny them 
            opportunities. A lack of funding can also have an impact on the resources 
            that schools are able to use, and create or prevent opportunities for 
            students. It is important that students from all financial backgrounds are 
            able to have equal access to education.
